069554.question: i believe in some reality videos (probably between 2014-2016 i think) you said you were working towards an album, or wanted to start an album, maybe thinking about making one? did you stop being interested in making an album at some point? or are you still just as interested as before? do you remember why you wanted to make an album? do you still want to make an album at some point? i know you've said you thought albums are boring, but i think you'll find that a lot of your audience would like an album by you. you could go about making it once you have an efficient schedule and have gotten to the point where you will be ready enough and confident enough to start uploading videos/songs/music videos like you would releasing all the songs as singles, where you could have a music video for each song, and just release both videos and songs, or maybe the album as all the music videos put together. or you could just make all the music videos a nd songs, but release the album as audio first (with the cover obviously if you make an album cover) and then either individually release all the music videos at certain intervals (I.E. every day until the music videos are all uploaded, every few days, every week, month. probably not longer than a month between releases if its already made.) or release all the music videos after the audio. or maybe you could take a few of the songs you make (say, in the future you've released 11 songs with music videos in like 6 months) and you could make a cover, and call that an album. p.s. i would really enjoy an album from you, especially if all of the songs are similar within your style. @X
069554.answer: ah, as you can see, i think this perfectly illustrates why it is best to wait at least a year or two before composing the reality videos. those ones you saw, those were probably composed within a month or two of the original recording, and so i didn't have the proper perspective to know that the idea of doing an album was a very fleeting idea. looking at it now, seeing the big picture, at least the way i feel about it now, music albums don't work for me and they've never worked for me. whenever i receive music on an album, for some reason i always think i hate all the songs. but whenever i receive songs individually, there is a much higher chance i will like and appreciate that 1 song. i can't remember exactly why i thought an album would be a good idea at that time. but my point is that if i were assembling reality videos from that time period, now, i would obviously skip all the stuff where i am talking about making an album, so that way i wouldn't have to explain how or why i changed my mind i probably was confusing it with something with a bit more of a story line right but if it's not what i want to make, then i'm not going to make it good. that's the golden rule of content i have never had a good experience with an album. i think it's just too many new songs to digest at one time. it seems very fatiguing and it always seems like there's nothing good on the album. where as if those songs were released individually, in most cases i probably would have liked almost all of them. it is still my belief that songs are not at their strongest when grouped together with several other songs and no other connecting tissue such as visual or story or both, or more. in other words, what i'm saying is, and i'm sure i have said it here 100 times before, i think the key to making albums be the best they can be would be to make it so much more than an album that it would no longer be considered an album

069562.question: i've been trying to do creative work and have big ideas for a thing i want to write. i've been brainstorming and basically talking to myself in a text document that is purposefully designed to make me not look at it later. the process for this is a general thing i've been using for a while that i made so that i could write anything i want into a text document without worrying about me or someone else looking at it later (a side effect of this process is that no one else can look at it). this has also worked for smaller writing projects in the past (like really small) but i mean for this one to be huge and i'm worried that i'll lose these notes about the thing due to the limitations of human memory. i really do prefer writing in the comfort of my secure notebook though. should i just try to become more comfortable writing in a regular text document? the problem with that is that i'm worried that i'll censor the heck out of myself like i used to do an d some o f the real gems of ideas may never come out. i'm not sure what to do here. any tips?
069562.answer: i think the answer here is quite simple. keep writing in the 'blind' document as you have been, but also start a new document with notes and writings for this project, which you will refer to again and again, and update as the project goes on. write in the 2 documents side by side. discuss things in the 'blind' document, and then when you arrive at important updates/decisions and writings, put them in the project document

I know I'm far ahead on paper and I know I need my ears to catch up, but i really have little idea how I could achieve this. (the same thing happens when I try to learn a foreign language. I can read competently in my target language but with toddler level's understanding of audio messages. so it really blows my mind when I heard someone who learnt foreign languages primarily by listening or there are some amazing creatures called illiterate who can speak a language fluently without understanding its orthography). I've been clueless for really long time, and wh en I sea rch online I can only see people who got a great ear but have problem reading staff or sth, none of them in the opposite situation. The things I think I can do now is just doing some mechanical ear training exercise i.e. recognize intervals, chords in isolation one by one, or listening for the melody/chords of songs (mentioned in the previous question) in a fruitless and excruciatingly slow way and wonder along whether I practice the right way... any advice on what I should do? (train in alternative ways or do the same thing with some change)

069766.question: What's that funky chord in Stacy's mom? The "not the girl for me" part Is it like 3^7 -> 6min?
069766.answer: they are using distorted guitars, so in reality they will probably just play a lowish C in unison (song is in the key of E, for reference), but on paper as a song i would certainly say it's C° to C#min there. so in that sense making the C a 'power chord' would be rude, but not entirely a crime. they might have done it that way. or they might have fashioned it into a diminished chord actually, if only slightly. which can get kinda bloody on distorted guitars. anyway, i call it C° to C#min. and again for C#min the similar story applies, except for that one the 'power chord' status is not discouraged, it is helpful and likely. i'm just giving my professional opinion, i have not specifically consulted the audio for this question, although i am familiar with the song in general and have heard it several times before. And before i forget- to harken back to your original answer, yes absolutely correct, although again i would recommend putting the bass on C. which i'm 90% is what they did but as i said this is just from the way i remember it. Ok i'm going to stop being lazy and just go listen to it since i have already rambled on it for this long: ok yes, they have C in the bass, and F# in there also. which is the best all around compromise. executing the Cdim which as i said would be quite bloody on the distortion but that's the way it goes. it's always a challenge to make this kind of real harmony happen with distortion on (basically anything except 5ths and 4ths will make a mess) but yea, they did exactly what i would recommend. played it right down the middle, using C and F# notes to approximate Cdim in just enough detail to work properly while still keeping the sludge to a minimum

069802.question: do you ever get that feeling when you look at someone else's work, be it art/music/something else, and it has this inherent, irreplicable specialness to it that no one could ever imitate in a million years no matter how hard they tried, and then you look at your own work and you just don't get that feeling? like your own work seems so blatant and manifest in what it's trying to do that no one could ever possibly look at it and say "wow, i wonder how/why they chose to do it that way" or "what does this weird/ambiguous detail mean, what was the creator thinking when they inserted that?" like even if you tried purposely to insert those weird/ambiguous things it wouldn't work or be interesting because you would just inserting them for the sake of trying to be weird/interesting? like I just want to know how to make genuinely interesting things that are interesting for their own sake and not just for the sake of trying to be interesting, but I worry that I don't have "what it takes". like maybe the fact that I'm so worried about whether or not what i make is genuinely interesting is actually an indicator that i'm not a person capable of making interesting things
069802.answer: occasionally, but that mostly depends on my mood i think it depends on how badly you want it, and if you think to yourself 'yes, that's how badly i want it' then the funny thing is i think you will find out that you already have it. the major hint i can give you for this is that it will be exactly what you want it to be, but the problem is because it's so new you may not have seen it before. so you may have to launch a bit of a search coalition. this may seem scary, but i promise it is fun. so fun that you probably won't worry about it not being interesting, instead you will be scared that you can't find enough places to distribute all of the interestingness so you don't drown in all the interestingness

069885.question: 3.3.20 3:30 am hey bill, thanks for answering.see i'm in my second year of college, and obviously that's not a place where you want to be lazy, but i have managed to just slip by in grades with some luck and the help of classmates. the point is; i always end up doing things at the last moment, were it be studying for a test or doing homework, i always do them at the last day, at the last hour, but somehow, i have managed to survive, just survive. and now the thing is i don't want to keep doing that, i don't want to be so lazy. i have lots of free days and spare time and i know i should use that free time studying or doing my homework, but i just don't want to do either of them, because doing something i don't want to just makes me feel awful, almost miserable, like i'm being forced into doing something i hate. but at the same time i know i should not feel that way and i should be more responsible . sorry for the long answer, but short answer to your question, what i want to do if i weren't so lazy is study and do my homework in my free time instead of doing nothing.
069885.answer: there is no such thing as lazy. if you feel no energy to do something that means you are not getting why it could be so gosh damn much fun. and maybe there is actually no way for it to be fun but i would be skeptical of that because most things are fun, but the trick is you need to unlock the fun. often in your own entirely unique way. and if you haven't figured out how to do that, then it's going to be extremely extremely unappealing to you. like so unappealing it will be completely impossible to move forward with it. so as i said, there is no such thing is 'lazy', it just means you haven't figured out how much fun the thing could be right, that is nature's way of saying don't do bad stuff. pretty handy how it says that doing bad stuff is not responsible. the question is, is the thing actually good and you just haven't unlocked its creamy goodness hm ... i thought you said you hated it and didn't want to do it

069992.question: what am I supposed to do with my left hand when playing piano? I know some options are "play a deep bass note" or "play a bassline" but I'm more interested in what people are doing when they have both hands in the middleish range of the keyboard and are playing more than one note in the left hand. Is that just a means of playing wide chords?
069992.answer: i doubt it. there's hardly even room for 2 hands in the real chordal zone of the keyboard. if someone else is playing the bass, AND someone else is playing the melody, then what i usually do is tie my left hand behind my back. if you are supposed to play the melody and chords both on the instrument, then you're gonna have to put chords in left hand and melody in right hand and to be honest i don't have a lot of experience doing that. if you have chords and no bass player, and you are singing the melody, then i think you definitely are going to want to take care of the bass in the left hand and chords with the right. so as you can see, the piano is like a banquet table. it is used in all different ways depending on how many and who the guests are and make sure you don't put 2 whole turkeys in the exact same spot

069993.question: hey, so it seems like the only instruments that remain consistent throughout an entire arrangement of yours is like bass and drums. that would make sense to like explain the fills you do to express the harmony and stuff. i mean there are outliers, the harpsichord on outside. the strings in school. but is this true, more or less?
069993.answer: that might be because when different instruments play the role of the bass, they are all usually called the bass. when different instruments play the role of the drums/percussion, they are always called drums/percussion. however, when many different instruments play the role of the middle/chord/melody range, people like to call those instruments by different names. so mostly i think it's a naming situation you are noticing

069995.question: How do you answer questions correctly?

069996.question: If you close your eyes and hit a random key on your keyboard, could you tell what note it is? And how useful is it? Would you recommend learning it?
069996.answer: sure well, if you have recently heard or played any other notes which you know what they are, then, ANY other note that is played, you MUST know what it is. if you can't get that then you need to get that. However, if you have not recently heard any sound or notes or music which you know the actual notes of, like for example if you just woke up in the morning and have no memory of any songs or notes that you can identify, then it is not expected that you be able to blindly identify the next note. having that skill would be called absolute pitch, and it's kind of like when you can identify a note in a completely and absolutely musicless way, with no musical relation to anything. this is a strange skill that is not related to music in any way whatsoever. To get back to your original question, yes i would be able to identify the note, because i can always remember the last note i heard, and i knew what that one was, so therefore i will know what the next one is when i hear it. also when doing this on a physical keyboard it is made even easier by the fact that the keyboard is shaped in such a way that you can eliminate about half of the notes just based on shape of the key physically
